properties.Name: StoreType
properties.Description:
A categorization of stores based upon common characteristics or functionality.

Ex:
- Central Business District
- Community Center
- Convenience Store
- Discount Store
- Discount-Anchored Center
- Gas Station
- Neighborhood Center
- Pad Site 
- Power Shopping Center
- Regional Center
- Strip Center
- Superstore 
- Warehouse Club
- Warehouse Store

where:

CENTRAL BUSINESS DISTRICT
 The traditional downtown business area of a city or town.
 
COMMUNITY CENTER
 A large shopping center that includes a discount store, specialty department store, super drugstore, home-improvement center and other convenience and shopping goods stores.
 
CONVENIENCE STORE
 A shopping center that typically includes such stores as a convenience store and a dry cleaner.
 
DISCOUNT STORE
 A general merchandise retailer offering a wide variety of merchandise,  limited service and low prices:

Ex:
- Target 
- Kmart
 
DISCOUNT-ANCHORED CENTER
 A shopping center that contains one or more discount stores plus smaller retail tenants.
 
NEIGHBORHOOD CENTER
 A shopping center that includes a supermarket, drugstore, home-improvement center or variety store.  

Neighborhood centers often include small stores, such as apparel, shoe, camera and other shopping goods stores.
 
PAD SITE
 A location for a free-standing retail building that sits in front of a mall or shopping center.
 
POWER SHOPPING CENTER
 A large, open-air shopping center with the majority of space pre-leased to several well-known anchor retail tenants.  

Convenient access and parking are emphasized.  These centers usually sit on major intersections.
 
REGIONAL CENTER
 A shopping center or mall which includes up to three department stores plus shopping or specialty stores rather than convenience stores.  
Super-regionals are similar but have at least four department stores.
 
STRIP CENTER
 A small shopping center that comprises several adjacent stores located along a major street or highway.
 
SUPERSTORE A large supermarket or specialty store, usually between 20,000 and 100,000 square feet.
 
WAREHOUSE CLUB
 A retail store that sells a limited assortment of general merchandise to customers who are members of the club. Memberships are generally fee-based, margins are small and there is little customer service provided to the members.
 
WAREHOUSE STORE
 A discount retailer offering merchandise in a no-frills environment.

Columns.Name: StoreTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Store Type.

Columns.Name: StoreTypeName
Columns.Description: The name of a Store Type.

Columns.Name: StoreTypeDescription
Columns.Description: The description of a Store Type.
